title: Irene
notes: Irene was premiered in the Burgtheater on 21 Jan 1781, and performed only three times before being dropped.

title: Der Sturm
notes: Schletter: "Der Sturm nach Schakes= / prar [sic] von Schink."'

title: Die Freundschaft auf der Probe
notes: Performed only twice before being dropped.

title: La Belle Arsène
notes: Schletter: "La Belle Arsene O. 3. A. / avec Ballets"

title: Juliane von Lindorak
notes: Schletter: "Juliane v. Lindorack. / L. in 5 A. n. Gozzi / v. Schöder."

title: Der Bettelstudent
notes: Schletter: "Der Bettelstudent L. in / 2. A. v. Weidmann."

title: L'Amant jaloux, ou les Fausses Apparences
Die donnernde Legion
notes: Morrow (249) cites a poster in the Theatermuseum, but does not give the title. Weidmann is named as the librettist on Czech Wikipedia. His name is not on the libretto.

title: Irene
notes: Final performance.Schletter: "Irene. / (Die Einnahme war / Mlle. Jaquet bestimmt."

title: Aline, reine de Golconde
notes: Schletter: "La Reine Golconde op. / 3. A. et Ballet."

title: Die Freundschaft auf der Probe
notes: Second of only two performances before being dropped.

title: Edelmuth in Niedrigkeit
notes: Schletter: "Edelmuth in Niederigkeit. / L. 1. A. Die Strafe im / Sturz. B. v Sacco."

title: Das Landmädchen
notes: Schletter: "Das Landmädchen L. in / 5. A. a. d. Engl."

title: Zémire et Azor
notes: Schletter: "Zemire &. Azor. O. 4. A. / et Ballet."

title: Präsentirt das Gewehr
notes: Schletter: "Präsentirt das Gewehr L. / 2. A. Die Matrosen." Präsentirt das Gewehr had been in the repertory of the court theater since 17 Jun 1775, but this performance in the Kärntnertortheater is not in Hadamowsky.

title: Matrosen Ballet
notes: Schletter: "Präsentirt das Gewehr L. / 2. A. Die Matrosen."Not specified whether this is actually the "Matrosen Ballet" of earlier in the month.

title: Die pücefarbnen Schuhe, oder Die schöne Schusterin
notes: Schletter: "Die schöne Schusterinn / S. in 2. A. a. d. Fr."

title: La Rosière de Salency
notes: Schletter: "La Rosiere de Salency O. / 3. A. et Ballet." A German version, Das Rosenfest zu Salenci, has been in the repertory of the court theater company since 9 Sep 1779.

title: Concert, Peter Winter and Franz Tausch
notes: "Musikalische Akademie zum Vortheil der Herrn Winter und Tausch. In Churbayer. Diensten."Cf. 26 Mar

title: Wahrheit ist gut Ding
notes: "Wahrheit ist gut Ding / L. in 5. A. / nach dem Lügner d. Gold. / frey bearbeitet v. Schle= / ter."

title: Le Barbier de Séville
notes: "Babier [sic] de Seville O. [sic] 4. A. / La belle Cordoniere. O. / 2. A."

title: La Belle Cordonniere
notes: "Babier [sic] de Seville O. [sic] 4. A. / La belle Cordoniere. O. / 2. A."May be Les souliers mors-dorés, ou La cordonniere allemande (see work record).

title: Die Näscherinn
notes: "Die kleine Näscherinn. L. / 1. A. die Horazier. B."Probably = to "Die Näscherinn"?

title: Die junge Indianerinn
notes: Earliest Viennese performance in Hadamowsky on 5 Apr 1769 in the Kärntnertortheater.

title: Erwine von Steinheim
notes: "Ermine [sic] v. Steinheim / Tr. im 5. A. v. Blum= / auer."

title: La Fausse Magie
notes: Hadamowsky has a production by the court theater premiering on 27 Jun 1809.

title: Concert, Johann Konrad Schlick and Christian Danner
notes: "Musikalische Akademie. zum Vortheil Herrn. Schlick. K. M. aus Gotha und Herrn Tanner aus München."

title: Der Hausvater
notes: Only performance in 1781. First performed in Vienna in 1770.

title: Hanns bleibt Hanns, oder der Bauer, ein Fürst
Die Pilgrime von Mekka
notes: Premiere in the Burgtheater on 26 Jul 1780

title: Der Sklavenhändler von Smyrna
notes: Premiere. Performed only one more time on 21 Feb before being permanently dropped.

title: Concert, Anton Ulbrich
notes: "Musikalische Akadamie zum Vortheil Hr. Anton Ulbrich, von WIen.""Anton" may have been either Anton Ignaz Ulbrich (1706–1796) or his son Anton Johann Nepomuk (1754–1830), both trombonists. Neither is known to have composed. One wonders whether this might have been a family concert, perhaps also including Johann Nepomuk Maximilian (1743–1814), who was a composer.

title: Hanns bleibt Hanns, oder der Bauer, ein Fürst
Soliman der Zweyte, oder Die drey Sultaninnen
Le Mercure galant ou la Comédie sans titre
Das Winterquartier in Amerika
notes: Zinzendorf attended this performance and that of Der eifersüchtige Liebhaber. It was his first attendance of a public theatrical performances since his return from Trieste."♃. 22. Fevrier. [...] Dela au Spectacle national. D[as] WinterQuartier in America. La Jaquet, jolie actrice. Der eifersüchtige Liebhaber opera comique françois traduit. belle musique. Adamberger chanta bien. La Lang qui est grosse point parfaitement, Vischer bien. L'air de Alonso Sans jalousie point d'amour. J'etois avec M:e de Thun dans la loge du C:te Rosenberg."

title: Concert, Tebaldo Monzani
notes: This was Monzani's only known appearance in Vienna

title: Das Loch in der Thüre
notes: "Hr. Autors Einnahme."This was the third performance, and the proceeds went to Stephanie d. J.Zinendorf attempted to go to this performance, but couldn't find a seat.

title: Hanns bleibt Hanns, oder der Bauer, ein Fürst
Die pücefarbnen Schuhe, oder Die schöne Schusterin
Hanns bleibt Hanns, oder der Bauer, ein Fürst
Concert, Valentin Adamberger
notes: "Musikalische Akademie. / Zum Vortheil Hr. Adambergers Mitglied d. K. K. / N. H. Schaubühne."

title: Concert, Mathias Thurner
notes: "Dergleichen z. V. Hr. Thurners, M. d. Orchest. b. Nationaltheater."Mathias Thurner was a flutist in the orchestra of the court orchestra in Vienna; see Steblin, JAMIS 2008.

title: Concert, French company
notes: "Dergleichen z. V. der Unternehmer des Franz. Schauspiels."

title: Alcide al bivio (TKS)
notes: "Dergleichen z. V. der Tonkünstler Gesellschaft allhier. Alcid am Scheidwege."The planned concerts of the Tonkünstler-Societät before Christmas 1780 had been postponed because of the death of Empress Maria Theresia on 29 Nov 1780. The society's concerts on 11 and 13 Mar 1781 made up for these; the society also held its usual concerts at the end of Lent, on 1 and 3 Apr 1781.

title: Concert, Józef Boruwłaski (dwarf)
notes: "Dergleichen / z. V. Hr. Boruwlaski in Königl. Pohlnischen / Diensten."See Boruwłaski's description of his visit to Vienna in 1781 and his concert in his autobiography, 159ffMorrow (249) notes that the concert is in Zinzendorf, who mentions a guitar player and Adamberger

title: Il natale di Apollo (concert)
notes: "Dergleichen / z. V. Hr. Righini, gen. Apolls Geburtstag."Il natale di Apollo is usually said to have been composed for the concert of the Tonkünstler-Societät in Dec 1789 (see Christoph Henzel, "Righini, Vincenzo," Grove Music Online). This performance in 1781 suggests that the work may have existed in some form at this earlier date.

title: Concert, Friedrich Ramm
notes: "Dergleichen / z. V. Hr. Ramms in Churbayer. Diensten."

title: Concert, Elisabeth Mara
notes: "Dergleichen / z. V. der Madame Mara."In Schletter, the date appears as "Dienstag / d. a2. [sic]"MBA, iii:101, Wolfgang to Leopold, 24 Mar:"die Mara ist hier; – sie hat vergangen dienstag eine accademie im Theater gegeben. – ihr Mann hat sich nicht dürfen sehen lassen, sonst hätte das orchstre nicht accompagnirt, weil er in die Zeitungen gedruckt hat, i ganz Wien seye kein Mensch im stande ihm zu accompagniren."

title: Il natale di Apollo (concert)
notes: Reprise of Il natale di Apollo

title: Concert, Peter Winter and Franz Tausch
notes: "Dergleichen / z. V. Hr. Winter und Tausch, in Churbayer. / Diensten."Cf. 2 Feb

title: Concert, Madame Olivieri
notes: "Dergleichen / z. V. der Madame Olivieri."Madame Olivieri not yet identified

title: Concert, Madame Varenne
notes: "Dergleichen / z. V. der Madam Varennes."In ZinzendorfMadame Varenne played in concerts at the French ambassador's on 24 Mar, 28 Mar, 7 Apr, and 5 May 1781 (on 7 Apr with "Herr Varene", violin), and on 4 Apr at Prince Paar.

title: Die Pilgrime auf Golgotha (TKS)
notes: The oratorio Die Pilgrime auf Golgotha was composed by Johann Georg Albrechtsberger (1736–1809). All four vocal soloists were members of the ensemble of the court theater in Vienna, and all created roles in Mozart's Die Entführung aus dem Serail the following year: Caterina Cavalieri (1755–1801; Konstanze); Therese Teyber (1760–1830; Blonde); Valentin Adamberger (1743?–1804; Belmonte); and Ludwig Fischer (1745–1825; Osmin).

title: Die Pilgrime auf Golgotha (TKS)
notes: Albrechtsberger's Die Pilgrime auf Golgatha was performed.A Mozart symphony was performed and he played the piano.

title: Agnes Bernauerinn
notes: Zinendorf attended this premiere, calling it a "mauvaise tragedie", noting, however, "Schroeder qui fit le rôle du Duc Albert de Bavière, joua comme un ange."

title: Agnes Bernauerinn
notes: This performance was attended by the Emperor, Archduchesses Maria Anna, Maria, and Maria Elisabeth, and Duke Albert von Sachsen-Teschen (WZ, Sat, 21 Apr 1781, no. 32, [6]

title: Die verfolgte Unbekannte
notes: Zinzendorf attended this performance, writing "Belle musique."

title: Wissenschaft geht vor Schönheit
notes: This performance in the Burgtheater is not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Because it took place on a Friday, it may have been a benefit. Hadamowsky has the Burgtheater as "geschlossen" on this day."Wissenschaft. geht vor / Schonheit [sic]. / L. in 3. A. n. G. v. B."

title: Die Gefahren der Verführung
notes: Performed only four times before being dropped.

title: Adelaide, oder die Antipathie gegen die Liebe
Die Gefahren der Verführung
notes: Zinzendorf attended this performance, writing: "Je trouvois Schroeter excellent en vieillard, jeu noble, [debit] agréable."

title: Les Deux Chasseurs et la Laitière
notes: "L'Offcier & le grand Baillif. C. 5. / la Laitiere. C. 1. a."Identification of "La Laitiere" as the work by Anseaume and Duni is provisional.

title: Andromeda und Perseus
notes: Performed only four times before being dropped.

title: Adrast und Isidore, oder die Nachtmusik
Die verstorbene Ehefrau
notes: Not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Possibly a benefit.

title: Concert, Johann Lausch
notes: "Musikalische Akademie / z. V. Hr. Johann Lausch."

title: Adelaide, oder die Antipathie gegen die Liebe
Monsieur de St. Charles
notes: Zinzendorf attended these performances: "Le soir au Theatre de la porte de Carinthie. L'Homme comme il y en a peu. Dalainval, Calet et le jolie M:elle Laurens jouerent fort bien. La Servante maitresse bien jouée et mal chantée."

title: La Servante maitresse
notes: On Zinzendorf's reaction, see the preceding entry.

title: Der flatterhafte Ehemann
notes: Zinzendorf attended this performance: "Le soir au Spectacle der flatterhaffte Liebhaber [sic]. Schroeter y joua a merveille en pauvre rôle [...]"

title: Les Deux Chasseurs et la Laitière
Die verstorbene Ehefrau
notes: Not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Benefit? Hadamowsky has the Burgtheater as "geschlossen" on this day.

title: Wer wird sie kriegen
notes: Premiere on the same day as the last of three performances of Eckardt's Die Schwäger. Performed only three times.

title: Der Schubkarren des Essighändlers
notes: "Der Eßighandler. / L. in 3. A. a. d. Fr."Adapted from Mercier's La Brouette du vinaigrier.Zinzendorf attended these peformances: "Le soir au Theatre. der Wein Eßig Händler. mauvais pièce que Schroeter rendit tres suportable par son jeu excellent. Ariadne zu Naxos Ein melodrama. M:e Schroeter tres bien [****], joua assez bien. L'orage a merveille."

title: Ariadne auf Naxos
notes: Zinzendorf attended these peformances: "Le soir au Theatre. der Wein Eßig Händler. mauvais pièce que Schroeter rendit tres suportable par son jeu excellent. Ariadne zu Naxos Ein melodrama. M:e Schroeter tres bien [****], joua assez bien. L'orage a merveille."

notes: Morrow, 250, based on entry in Zinzendorf

title: Dupuis et Desronais
notes: "Dupuis & des Ronæls.C. / 3. a."This title only in Bender (based on Schletter). Schinke has "Depuis & de Ronais".

title: Der Zaubergürtel
notes: Not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Friday benefit? Hadamowsky has the Burgtheater as "geschlossen."

title: Ariadne auf Naxos
notes: Not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Friday benefit? Hadamowsky has the Burgtheater as "geschlossen."

title: Andromeda und Perseus
notes: Zinzendorf attended this performance: "Andromede melodrame musique de M. Zimmer,ann. M:e Sacco joua comme un ange. le mot de Wahrheit quelle expression elle lui donna, en [***]ant a Persée qu'elle l'aime."

title: L'Officieux
notes: Zinzendorf attended these perfromances: "Au Spectac;le françois. L'homme officieux, puis Nanette et Lucas."

title: Le Cercle ou la Soirée à la mode
notes: "La Soiree a la Mode. C. 1. a."

title: Die Brüder

title: Concert, Monsieur Cervasi
notes: Sartori:	Matteo Gervasi, composer of La Mistica vittoria (1772)	Giuseppe Gervasoni, a singer active in the early 1780s	Susanna Gervasio, singerGerber 1790, only name even close is Mr. Gervais, violinist who appeared at the Concert spirituel in Paris.There was a tenor Cesare Cervasi in the 1820s

title: Hamlet
notes: Probably with Schröder in the title role?

title: Adrast und Isidore, oder die Nachtmusik
Hanns bleibt Hanns, oder der Bauer, ein Fürst

title: Eugenie, oder Die Tugend in Gefahr
Jeannot et Colin
notes: First performed in Paris for the first time 14 Nov 1780. Adapted from a "conte philosophique" by Voltaire (1764)

title: Concert, Floravante Agostinelli
notes: "Musikalische Akademie z. V. v. Mrs. Agostinelli.""Mrs." is probably "Monsieur," based on Schletter's apparent usage. There is a soprano Angela (Angelica) Agostinelli in Sartori in libretti from 1765 to 1767."Agostinelli" not in Gerber 1790 or Morrow. See Bernardini 1988, on the Venetian oboist/flutist Floravante Agostinelli (1741–1809). See his note 12. Alternate first names are "Francesco Saverio" and "Florante". He was employed by the Thurn und Taxis court for 32 years. Burney heard him in Ludwigsburg in 1772.Often referred to (Badley, Murray, Powell) as "Florante"

title: Die pücefarbnen Schuhe, oder Die schöne Schusterin
Milton und Elmire
notes: "Milton und Elmire / A. v. Göthe. Ballet."Schletter may have confused Milton und Elmire with Goethe's Erwin und Elmire, which had been in the repertory of the court theater since 1776.

title: Der Liebhaber als ein Schriftsteller und Bedienter
Héraclite, ou le Triomphe de la Beauté
Inkle und Yariko
notes: Confusion over multiple works with this or related titles.

title: La Comédie à l'impromptu, ou les Dupes
Adelaide, oder die Antipathie gegen die Liebe

Die zwey Gräfinnen
notes: German version of Le due contesse, which had been performed in Vienna in 1776 and 1777.

title: La Comédie à l'impromptu, ou les Dupes
notes: "Les Dupes. O. 1. a."Uncertain whether this work, listed as an opera, is the same as La Comédie à l'impromptu, ou les Dupes performed by the French company in July.

title: Theaters closed (anniversary of death of Francis Stephen)

notes: Hadamowsky has Die Widersprecherin on this date

Adelheit von Veltheim
notes: This work and performance is not in Hadamowsky.

title: Theaters closed for Mariä Geburt (Nativity of Mary)
Le Déserteur
notes: The directors of the French company absconded from Vienna on 8 Sep 1781 because of the company's poor finances. The company chose Le Petit as in interim internal director. They were allowed to continue their performances, but the emperor resolved on 8 Sep: “aber ihre Effecten, die vermutlich denen Entrepreneurs gehörten, sind für die Schuldner in Beschlag zu nehmen" (Hadamowsky, 464).

title: Die pücefarbnen Schuhe, oder Die schöne Schusterin
Die Schwiegermutter
notes: This performance, on a Friday, is not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna/

notes: From the 1781 Viennese libretto: "Aufgeführt auf dem k. k. Hof=Nationaltheater von der in der Schauspielkunst sich übenden Jugend."

notes: Entry to the theater was free in celebration of the news of Marie Antoinette's successful delivery of a male child and potential heir to the French throne, Louis-Joseph de France, on 22 Oct 1781. (Louis-Joseph died on 4 Jun 1789.)

title: Das Landmädchen
notes: Das Landmädchen was in the repertory of the court theater company. This free performance in the Kärntnertortheater is not in Hadamowsky.

title: La Belle Cordonniere
notes: Free in celebration of the news of Marie Antoinette's successful delivery of a male child and potential heir to the French throne, Louis-Joseph de France, on 22 Oct 1781. (Louis-Joseph died on 4 Jun 1789.)

title: Der Furchtsame
notes: Hadamowsky has the Burgtheater closed on this day. The earliest performance of Der Furchtsame in Hadamowsky was on 1 Sep 1764, and the latest on 19 Jan 1779.

title: L'Amant jaloux, ou les Fausses Apparences
Robert und Kalliste
notes: First performed by the court theater in Vienna on 1 Oct 1778.

title: Philotas
notes: Perhaps given by the Theaterschule? No Viennese playbook in the ÖNB.

title: Die Liebe unter den Handwerksleuten
notes: This performance is missing in Hadamowsky.

notes: Not specified as being done by the Kindertheater, but Präsentirt das Gewehr was in their repertoire.

title: Three arias sung by Giorgio Crinazzi
notes: Tenor Giorgio Crinazzi (1750–1782) was in Vienna by the early months of 1781, where he was the singing teacher of the daughters of Leopold von Auenbrugger. On 23 Jun 1781 he signed a four-month contract with the Esterházy kapelle, but fell ill and returned to Vienna in the fall. He died in Vienna on 31 Dec 1782. See https://it.wikipedia.org/wiki/Giorgio_Crinazzi (which cites no sources).

notes: Mademoiselle Hauck's second concert in the Kärntnertortheater was previously unknown.

title: Concert, Karl Chorus and his sons
notes: Schletter: "Grosse musilkalische Akademie, zum Vortheil Herrn Chorus und seiner zween Söhne, wovon der eine 15, der andere 12 Jahr war."Portheim 577: Karl Chorus, oboist. born Prague, in Esterhazy-Kapelle 1771–1776, check Haydn Jb 1983/84:92. See also notes on Chorus in Concert database.

title: Concert, Aloysia Lange
notes: SchletterL "Grosse musikalische Akademie, zum Votheil des Mad. Lange, Sängerinn bey der k. k. National=Hofschaubühne."

title: Concert, Vittorino Colombazzo
notes: Schletter: "Grosse musikalische Akademie, zum Vortheil Herrn Vitturino Columbazzo."Vittorino Colombazzo was an oboist in the Esterházy Kapelle in 1768, and in 1779–1780 (as “Franz”).  See Harich, “Das Haydn-Orchester im Jahr 1780,” esp. pp. 27-28.  Engaged the last four months of 1768 (the oboe solo in Symphony 38 may have been written with him in mind).  Previously in the service of the Großherzog of Württemberg (in 1767, according to Landon).  Second engagement from 15 Oct 1779, but dismissed for some offense on 15 Mar 1780.  Said by Pohl (see ref. in Harich) to have given a concert in Vienna with singer Jermoli and hornist Franz Stamitz.  See also Landon, HCW/ii, 70.  Later in the service of the Prince of Thurn und Taxis in Regensburg?Colombazzo was in the court theater orchestras in Vienna in the years 1772–1776, and he seems to have freelanced in Vienna in the 1780s. For details, see the record for Colombazzo in the Concert database.

title: Concert, Valentin Adamberger
